PrimEcoSys: West Gulf Coastal Plain Seepage Swamp and Baygall

habitat_description:
The distribution of the Texas map turtle is restricted to the Colorado River drainage, particularly the Edwards Plateau portion that extends from west to central Texas (Bartlett and Bartlett 1999). This benthic species is known to burrow in or using soil, but also decaying logs and vegetative litter. 

The habitat is characterized by low gradient streams, medium sized rivers with moderate currents, and shallow water pools, oxbows, lakes, and ponds. Rivers where this species is found usually have moderate currents, vast vegetation, and basking logs/rocks (Bartlett and Bartlett 1999).

The water bodies where this species is found usually provide dense aquatic vegetation as well as riparian ground cover.
